intro: Turritis saxatilis, commonly known as the rock turritis, is a flowering plant belonging to the Acanthaceae family. It is native to southern Africa and is typically found growing in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features showy, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. It is adapted to arid environments and has a low-growing, mat-forming habit. Turritis saxatilis is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
